aspecttable.name: BR-2003
aspecttable.reference: As described in the June 2003 edition of Signals and indicators controlling train movements, GE/RT8000 - S1 Rule Book

aspect.name: Preliminary Caution
aspect.description: Proceed: be prepared to find the next signal displaying one yellow aspect

aspect.name: Flash Preliminary Caution
aspect.description: Proceed: be prepared to find the next signal displaying one flashing yellow aspect
aspect.comment: 4 Aspect Signals Only with a diverging route.

aspect.name: Caution
aspect.description: Proceed: be prepared to stop at the next signal

aspect.name: Flash Caution
aspect.description: Proceed: the next signal will be at caution with a junction indicator showing
aspect.comment: 3+4 Aspect Signals Only with a diverging route.

aspect.name: Call On
aspect.indication: Red Aspect and Two White Aspect Showing
aspect.description: If the main Signal is showing Danger and the position-light signal displays two white lights at 45degrees, this authorises the driver to proceed at caution towards the next stop signal, Buffer stop and be prepared to stop short of any obstruction.

aspect.name: Junction Indicator
aspect.description: To show that a train is being signalled to a route to the left or right of the straight route

aspect.name: Stop (Yellow/White)
aspect.description: This indicates stop, if the points are set for a route that would take the movement onto a running line. Movements are allowed to pass the signal if it is being made towards a shunt neck or siding.

aspect.name: Proceed at Caution
aspect.description: If the position-light signal displays two white lights at 45degrees, this authorises the driver to proceed at caution towards the next stop signal, Buffer stop and be prepared to stop short of any obstruction.
